thread.title: Taskforce, Savannah-Chatham police arrest final suspect involved in Sept. triple shooting
thread.title_full: Taskforce, Savannah-Chatham police arrest final suspect involved in Sept. triple shooting | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: Taskforce, Savannah-Chatham police arrest final suspect involved in Sept. triple shooting
text:
By Savannah Morning News The Southeast Regional Task Force along with Savannah-Chatham police officers assigned to the task force arrested the final suspect involved in a triple shooting that occurred on Sept. 12 on Savannah’s west side.
Quamelius Lee, 20, was wanted for murder and armed robbery in reference to the shooting that occurred on the 1400 block of Barnes Drive, said Michelle Gavin, Savannah-Chatham police spokeswoman. Lee was arrested in an apartment on Woodhouse Lane in Savannah last night and was taken into custody without incident, Gavin said.
On Sept. 12, Javon Wilson, 19, and Asim Simmons, 19, were waiting to sell a cellular phone outside of a nearby apartment building. The two men were approached at gunpoint by at least two subjects. Shots rang out, hitting both victims, as they attempted to defend themselves, according to police spokeswoman Eunicia Baker.
Wilson and a third shooting victim identified as Jayquan Turner, 24, were pronounced dead at the scene, Baker said. Simmons was transported by ambulance to Memorial University Medical Center with non-life threatening injuries.
On Oct. 9 Savannah-Chatham police said that Emile Randolph, 32, who on Sept. 18 was charged with possession of a firearm by a convicted felon in this case, was charged with murder. Additionally, Tom Frazier, 18, was arrested at an apartment on the 11000 block of White Bluff Road and charged with armed robbery. Asim Simmons was arrested on the 100 block of Queen’s Retreat and charged with murder and armed robbery.
